physical_appearance:This is a landscape painting of the secret service camp at the foot of Bukit Segari. It features a few roofed structures and a clothing line at the bottom right of the painting. The left and foreground of the painting shows a hill with several trees. The camp looks nestled within a forested area. There is a Chinese inscription on the bottom-left of the painting.

sgcool_label_text:This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.\r\n\r\nThis drawing is a later rendition of the secret service camp at the foot of Bukit Segari Camp Ground by Tan Chong Tee. \r\n

metadata.title_text: Secret Service at the Foot of Bukit Segari ????????
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a landscape painting of the secret service camp at the foot of Bukit Segari. It features a few roofed structures and a clothing line at the bottom right of the painting. The left and foreground of the painting shows a hill with several trees. The camp looks nestled within a forested area. There is a Chinese inscription on the bottom-left of the painting.

metadata.subject_terms_3: Painting Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Tan, Chong Tee 1942-1945 Japanese occupation
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.

This drawing is a later rendition of the secret service camp at the foot of Bukit Segari Camp Ground by Tan Chong Tee.
